questions.question: How often do you check social media right after waking up?

options.text: Never – I start my day without checking my phone or social networks.
Sometimes – I check it only if I have free time in the morning.
Often – I usually open social media shortly after waking up.
Always – Checking social media is the first thing I do every morning.

questions.question: How much time do you spend daily on social networks?

options.text: Less than 1 hour – I use social media occasionally and with control.
1–2 hours – I use it regularly but without feeling dependent.
2–4 hours – Social media takes a significant part of my day.
More than 4 hours – I spend a large portion of my time scrolling.

questions.question: Do you feel anxious when you cannot access social media?

options.text: Not at all – I feel calm even without access to social platforms.
A little – I notice discomfort but it doesn’t affect me much.
Quite a lot – I feel stressed when I cannot check my accounts.
Extremely anxious – I feel nervous and unsettled without social media.

questions.question: How often do you lose track of time while scrolling?

options.text: Never – I always control the time I spend online.
Rarely – It happens occasionally but not often.
Often – I frequently spend more time than planned.
Almost always – I regularly lose hours without noticing.

questions.question: Do you use social media during meals or conversations?

options.text: Never – I focus fully on meals and people around me.
Sometimes – Only when I feel bored or distracted.
Often – I check my phone even during social moments.
Always – I cannot stop checking my phone even while talking.

questions.question: How hard is it for you to stop using social media?

options.text: Very easy – I can stop anytime without difficulty.
Somewhat easy – I stop with little effort.
Difficult – I struggle to stop when I start.
Almost impossible – I feel unable to stop scrolling.

questions.question: Do you check notifications while working or studying?

options.text: Never – I fully concentrate on my tasks.
Rarely – Only for urgent notifications.
Often – Notifications distract me regularly.
All the time – I constantly interrupt my work to check my phone.

questions.question: Do you feel the need to post regularly to feel satisfied?

options.text: No – I don’t feel the need to post content.
Sometimes – I post occasionally for fun.
Yes – Posting makes me feel validated.
Absolutely – I feel uncomfortable if I don’t post often.

questions.question: Have you tried to reduce your social media usage and failed?

options.text: Never tried – I already control my usage well.
Tried once – I made a small attempt.
Several times – I tried but couldn’t maintain it.
Many times – I repeatedly fail to reduce my usage.

questions.question: How does social media affect your mood?

options.text: No effect – My mood is independent of social media.
Slight effect – It affects me occasionally.
Strong effect – My mood often depends on online interactions.
Controls my mood – Likes and comments strongly affect how I feel.
